channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: From @WSJopinion: Is it the end of Russia’s empire? Moscow has a stake in the Ukraine war that is greater than Putin’s career, writes @wrmead https://t.co/Pb0RXheBy0
The White House said Tuesday that the Justice Department is still weighing whether to appeal the ruling striking down the mask mandate for public transportation https://t.co/USKckRRJFv
Ukraine’s government said it enlisted a group of social-media posters to shame companies still doing business in Russia https://t.co/3Mk8lJ7JtO
As investors buy more houses than ever to rent out, homeowners are rewriting the rules to stop them https://t.co/dF44BrtbcY
Breaking: Netflix lost 200,000 global subscribers in the first quarter and expects to lose 2 million more this spring. Shares fell 17% after hours. https://t.co/91Q5iNj4L2
U.S. relations with longtime ally Saudi Arabia have reached the breaking point. The risk for Washington is that Riyadh will align more closely with China and Russia. https://t.co/jjYziE56nA
Air France and Lufthansa still require masks on board, while British Airways and KLM say it depends on the destination https://t.co/6Cq9YH1a4G
Kyiv’s successful use of internet to counter Moscow highlights Taiwan’s reliance on undersea internet cables that China could cut https://t.co/qnZunoGkrj

Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis asked the state’s legislature on Tuesday to consider ending special tax districts established before 1968, including one that effectively lets Disney govern the land its theme parks are built on https://t.co/dl4Q3IGl2c

The Biden administration is restoring stricter environmental standards for approving new pipelines, highways, power plants and other construction projects, including requiring consideration of how such projects might affect climate change https://t.co/6SigZIfqli

Videos shared online show plane passengers cheering after a judge’s decision to throw out a public-transport mask mandate, while the White House recommended people still wear masks on planes, trains and buses #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/oCVhFoH59F https://t.co/avvusSEALT
The U.S. mask mandate on airplanes, taxis and other forms of public transit has been thrown out by a federal judge who said said it exceeded the authority of the CDC https://t.co/0zdWJZfBGO
Missiles hit Lviv in western Ukraine, killing six, Ukrainian officials said, in a sign Russia's weapons remain a threat far from the conflict's front lines https://t.co/ogaMrobjWV

Elon Musk, a self-described “free-speech absolutist,” said that Twitter is the “de facto town square,” and that “it’s very important for there to be an inclusive arena for free speech.” Here's what else he has planned. https://t.co/VHxf9O3kwx
“The light is killing me—it’s my main enemy here.” Spending weeks with thousands of strangers under 24/7 fluorescent lights: this is life in a Shanghai mass quarantine center. https://t.co/j1o8PDtEo8
Breaking: The U.S. mask mandate on airplanes, taxis and other forms of public transit was thrown out by a federal judge who said said it exceeded the authority of the CDC https://t.co/rjxKnuCYMd
Russia is tightening its hold over occupied areas of southern Ukraine, installing pro-Moscow leaders, hunting for dissenters and dismantling Ukrainian state institutions https://t.co/TXjDZhnZOY
As investors buy more houses than ever to rent out, homeowners are rewriting the rules to stop them https://t.co/vXV3bRErAL
Cancún and the Riviera Maya, Mexico’s top tourism spots, are fighting a wave of violent crime. The problem is demand for drugs by tourists. https://t.co/2NO9AEPHRW
Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe says the looming electric-vehicle battery shortage will make the current semiconductor shortfall feel like "a small appetizer" https://t.co/MQjWSRmUOC
Missiles hit Lviv in western Ukraine, in an attack that shattered the calm in a city where many Ukrainians had sought refuge https://t.co/eu8FFCRfWw

Elon Musk, a self-described “free-speech absolutist,” said that Twitter is the “de facto town square,” and that “it’s very important for there to be an inclusive arena for free speech.” Here's what else he has planned. https://t.co/Kuzh2l2EB8
A missile struck a kitchen used by chef José Andrés’s humanitarian organization in Ukraine, injuring four members of the team, the nonprofit said https://t.co/viUjXpKo0F
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal climbed by 45% last year. Here's what to know about why so many Americans are making the country their home base. https://t.co/2t8FIgFDpb
A missile struck a kitchen used by chef José Andrés’s humanitarian organization in Ukraine over Easter weekend, injuring four members of the team, the nonprofit said. https://t.co/RL62dc6lDS
Elon Musk might have more than 82 million Twitter followers, but only a handful of those can consistently grab the billionaire’s attention and rally Tesla’s social-media army. https://t.co/n7E5eh5GMR
Warren Buffett rented the Omaha house where he started his first solo investment fund for just $175 a month. Now, it's listing for $799,000. https://t.co/q4p7DixXTR
To talk to a loved one with Alzheimer’s, don’t ask them if they remember something. Get them to tell you a story, or sing a song. https://t.co/sWJJNJN32n

Tony Hawk is the subject of a new documentary about his life and career. The takeaway he wants everyone to have? "It’s okay to take risks and it’s okay to obsess on doing something you love and following your passion. It’s worth it." https://t.co/IluZktSw1T
Saudi Arabia forced out Yemen's elected president earlier this month, according to Saudi and Yemeni officials https://t.co/JicHBhnby8
How did Ukraine transform from a rigid Soviet-style military to a Westernized force? Years of NATO classes, drills and exercises. https://t.co/FJy0eeC663
The last Ukrainian troops holding out in besieged Mariupol rejected Moscow’s ultimatum on Sunday that they surrender or face destruction by Russian forces https://t.co/slMpy6E7kG

Russia called on the last Ukrainian troops fighting in Mariupol to lay down arms on Sunday and observe an hourslong cease-fire that it said would allow them to leave the battlefield unscathed https://t.co/alf9tXNLLY
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal climbed by 45% last year. Here's what to know about why so many Americans are making the country their home base. https://t.co/Lvw1NQyNsS

Elon Musk, a self-described “free speech absolutist,” said in an interview last week that Twitter is the “de facto town square,” and that “it’s very important for there to be an inclusive arena for free speech.” Here's what else he has planned: https://t.co/xR2RYFTHo6
“The light is killing me—it’s my main enemy here.” Spending weeks with thousands of strangers under 24/7 fluorescent lights: this is life in a Shanghai mass quarantine center. https://t.co/vAXAeEFSWC
Russia’s expanding military deployments in and around eastern Ukraine in recent days are setting the stage for a new phase of Moscow’s offensive https://t.co/RqXkavRDWI

“Yes, I called it genocide,” President Biden said shortly after his speech last week. “It has become clearer and clearer that Putin is just trying to wipe out the idea of even being, being able to be Ukrainian.” https://t.co/QW07K3DGBe

Russia called on the last Ukrainian troops fighting in Mariupol to lay down arms on Sunday and observe an hourslong cease-fire that it said would allow them to leave the battlefield unscathed https://t.co/DbDqejEXHK
Mariupol has been besieged by Russian troops and pro-Russia separatists for more than a month and has seen some of the fiercest urban warfare in the conflict in Ukraine. https://t.co/oK6cWa8vll
Fund manager, startup founder and blogger Eva Shang is cracking the private debt market. The $400 million she raised in six months says Wall Street is taking notice. https://t.co/35Th6NSucB

As Stephen Colbert was hatching his CBS program, he said he consciously conceived it to be a show about love, but “of course, you can’t say that out loud, because it sounds a little pretentious” https://t.co/eW5GINlj1t
This Easter, connect to Ukraine via pysanky, the country’s highly symbolic eggs, decorated in complex patterns using a centuries-old dye technique https://t.co/3oWswDRr5Q
Pope Francis in his annual Easter address called for peace in Ukraine, warning that the conflict could lead to nuclear war https://t.co/PsFqieesGF
Russia called on the last Ukrainian troops fighting in Mariupol to lay down arms and observe a cease-fire that it said would allow them to leave the battlefield unscathed https://t.co/LnrKDORfsy
Mariupol has been besieged by Russian troops and pro-Russia separatists for more than a month and has seen some of the fiercest urban warfare in the conflict in Ukraine. https://t.co/jyDl8rj9sV

The United Nations’ human-rights agency said that it recorded at least 1,982 civilian deaths in Ukraine since Russia invaded the country, but warned that actual figures could be much higher https://t.co/TFLTB2AeZh

Russia banned British Prime Minister Boris Johnson and other top U.K. officials from entering the country, citing London’s efforts to isolate Moscow over its invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/Dh5AGLvvTB
From @WSJopinion: Inflation in March was the highest in 40 years, and the year-long inflation spike was well underway before Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine https://t.co/81zEJgwPql
Cancún and the Riviera Maya, Mexico’s top tourism spots, are fighting a wave of violent crime. The problem is demand for drugs by tourists. https://t.co/7rWGMDgglY
